issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Description:
While testing "Options Dialog" on iPhone and iPod, I noticed, that options dialog does not change orientation after device is rotated from portrait to landscape.
This bug exists on 1.8.2 and 2.0.1. Does not reproduce with iPad devices.

Steps:
1. Run KitchenSink
2. Go to Base UI-Views-Options Dialog
3. Press "Show Dialog 1"
4. Rotate device to landscape mode

Expected result:
Options dialog should change orientation fron portrait to landscape 

Actual result:
Options dialog does not change orientation
fields.summary: iOS: KitchenSink - Options Dialog does not change orientation on iPhone and iPod
fields.environment:
Titanium Studio, build: 2.0.1.201204132053
Titanium SDK: 2.0.2.v20120417133255
Devices: iPhone 4S (5.1), iPod 3rd Gen (4.0.2)

comments.body:
Tested on:
Titanium Studio, build: 2.1.0.201206141932
Titanium SDK: 2.1.0.v20120615104152

The behavior is slightly different - not only options dialog, but also window does not change orientation from portrait to landscape.

The problem reproduces with release 3.1.0 and 3.0.2

Tested with

Titanium Studio, build: 3.0.1.201212181159
Titanium SDK version: 3.1.0 
Titanium SDK version: 3.0.2 
Device: Samsung galaxy s duos Android version: 4.0.4
Android Emulator: Android SDK version: 2.2
iOS iPhone Simulator: iOS SDK version: 6.0


Works perfectly on android

Issue reproduces 

Tested with

Titanium Studio, build: 3.0.1.201212181159
Titanium SDK version: 3.1.0 (03/11/13 15:43 0c88429)
Titanium SDK version: 3.0.2 (02/07/13 16:46 a4def81)
iOS iPhone Simulator: iOS SDK version: 6.0

jithinpv
Resolving ticket as Invalid as there is now a new version of Kitchen Sink available and we no longer support the version which relates to this ticket.
